concept.title: SDIO Tools Overview
concept.shortdesc: Describes the tools required for SDIO implementation.

conbody.p: Symbian Analysis Workbench (SAW) is used for debugging the Platform Specific Layer (PSL) implementation issues. SAW can be used to view the function calls between the Platform Independent Layer (PIL) and PSL.

section.title: SAW
section.p: The SAW tool binaries can be obtained from \\builds01\devbuilds\DeveloperProduct\ComponentisedReleases\tools_baseline\tools_saw\DP00468_DeveloperProduct. Extract the binaries into the Carbide.c++ plugins folder and restart Carbide to use the SAW tool.
Download the device side agents of the SAW tool from \\builds01\dpbuilds\SAW\SAW_1.0_002 and install into the epoc32 folder.

section.title: Extended trace information
section.p: To obtain detailed tracing information, the trace points in the PIL code should be enabled. The trace points are enabled by using the macro SYMBIAN_TRACE_SDIO_VERBOSE in the utraceepbussdio.h file.

section.title: Unit test tracing
section.p: To trace the function calls between SDIO drivers, unit test code and the PSL layer, define the macro SYMBIAN_TRACE_SDIO_DUMP in the utraceepbussdio.h file to enable the additional trace points.
